author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
FYI: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1

I see that this is a port of a `fri` python package, so it might make sense, although Julia packages are almost exclusively spelled with capital letters.

[noblock]

> FYI: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1
> 
> I see that this is a port of a `fri` python package, so it might make sense, although Julia packages are almost exclusively spelled with capital letters.

@fredrikekre Thanks for the hint.
I changed the name to uppercase F now.
Unfortunately the auto merge still looks for a folder with lowercase f.
Should I generate a new uuid for the package and try again or is there a better way?

Your `new package` pull request does not meet the following guidelines for auto-merging:

- Name is not at least five characters long
- The following dependencies do not have a compat entry that has an upper bound: ECOS, JuMP, julia

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->

Your `new package` pull request does not meet the following guidelines for auto-merging:

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

@fredrikekre Could you merge this manually? I would like to keep naming consistency between the python package and the julia version.

I've created release `v0.1.0`, [here](https://github.com/lpfann/Fri.jl/releases/tag/v0.1.0) it is.
<!-- c9be5900-1112-11ea-833d-009b4af54dca -->
